aboutPage.firstParagraph: Passengers are specific nomadic objects transmitted from hand to hand and whose journey can be traced on the internet. Small sizes, designed to invite you to grasp, these are unique pieces carved manually in wood and resin. Their shapes are inspired by both Paleolithic bifaces, the first anthropomorphic statuettes and the contemporary aesthetic of our smart-objects.
aboutPage.secondParagraph: Updated and made public by the participants themselves thanks to an internet address engraved on each Passenger, their respective news (geographic location and identity of the holder) can be viewed on this platform. Via this platform, anyone wishing to do so can welcome the Passenger of their choice by contacting their current holder and thus participate in their transmission.
aboutPage.projectCredit: The Passengers is a work by Fran√ßois Maurin.

authentificationPage.askSomeone: Ask a person in possession of a Passenger to lend it to you and make an appointment to collect it.
authentificationPage.findClosestArtwork: Find the Passenger closest to you
authentificationPage.reservedToParticipants: Space reserved for people who have participated.

accountSettingsPage.emailHelp: Your e-mail address will be used to contact you.
accountSettingsPage.emailHelp2: It will never be made public nor be shared to third parties.

introductionModal.firstParagraph: The Passengers are nomadic works of art. Transmitted without counterpart from one person to another, these objects move around the world.
introductionModal.secondParagraph: This site reports on their current situation, the history of their journey and allows you to take part in their transmission.

map.previousPositionDescription: The Passenger #{n} was previously at {city} ({country}) with {username}
map.currentPositionDescription: The Passenger #{n} is currently at {city} ({country}) with {username}
